More Political Parties Sign Pyongyang Declaration 
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The historic Pyongyang Declaration "Let Us Defend and Advance the Cause of Socialism" was signed by the secretary of the National Leadership of the United Democratic Party of Honduras and the international secretary of the United National Hope of Guatemala on behalf of their organisations on March 18.

articles.title: S. Korean Men of Culture Protest against FTA
articles.content:
S. Korean Men of Culture Protest against FTA 
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee of Moviemen to Check the Cultural Aggression and Defend Screen Quota and the Culture and Art Joint Measure Committee for Checking the South Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement and Securing Cultural Variety in south Korea reportedly co-sponsored a candle-light cultural festival at Maroni Park in university street of Seoul on April 1 to defend screen quota without fail and check the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. FTA.
 Speakers at the festival stressed that the struggle to defend screen quota should be a struggle of all the people on this land opposed to the conclusion of FTA. If they wage this struggle in close unity, it would be possible to check the conclusion of FTA and defend screen quota without fail, they said.    
 They declared that the men of culture would take the lead in the struggle.
 A resolution of struggle was read out at the festival. It called for punishing the U.S., who is seeking to colonize south Korea through the conclusion of FTA and reorganization of the south Korea-U.S. "alliance", and the pro-American flunkeyists obedient to it on behalf of the history and the people.

articles.title: U.S. Schemes to Sell New-type Missiles to S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Schemes to Sell New-type Missiles to S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- The Security Cooperation Agency of the U.S. Department of Defense announced through a congress report that it is pushing forward the sale of 42 new-type air-to-ship Harpoon missiles to south Korea, according to the south Korean KBS.
 The agency noted that the south Korean "government" has also asked for sale of new ship-to-ship Harpoon missiles, "UGM-841", which is able to be launched from submarine, and its technical support.    
 It was reported that the "government" would purchase such missiles to equip destroyers, submarines, cruisers and "F-16" fighter bombers, the KBS said.
 The situation is very serious as such scheme of the U.S. imperialists is being pushed ahead at the time when they get evermore pronounced in attempt to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK.

articles.title: Exhibition of Songhwa Art Studio Opens
articles.content:
Exhibition of Songhwa Art Studio Opens 
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of the Songhwa Art Studio was opened at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center on April 5 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
 On display at the exhibition are 60 pieces of art works including Korean paintings, oil and acrylic paintings and sculptures created by artists of the studio.
 Among them are Korean painting "Mangyongdae in Balmy Season," oil paintings "Mangyongdae in Spring" and "Mt. Paektu in April" and acrylic painting "Best Wishes of All People". They superbly represent in refined techniques the warm mind of the peoples of the DPRK and other parts of the world to significantly commemorate the Day of the Sun. 
 Korean paintings "Topic News from Forests of Mt. Paektu" and "The Mind Following the Sun," oil painting "Songun Is Always with the Monument to the Immortality" and sculpture "Yearning for the General" impressively portray the thoughts and sentiment of all the people who remain faithful to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
 There are also Korean paintings "We Greet Bumper Harvest in Spring" and "The Village under Apricot Trees" and oil paintings "Falls of Potato in Taehongdan" and "Worthwhile Life in Field", which depict the efforts of the Korean army and people making a greater leap forward towards the peak of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and the appearance of the DPRK which has been turned to the socialist fairyland.

Training Course Organized by ISF
articles.content:
Training Course Organized by ISF
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Training course for softball coaches and referees was held in Pyongyang from March 26 to 31 under the auspices of the International Softball Federation.
 The course was attended by coaches, referees and other experts of softball in the country.    
 It dealt with several issues through theoretical and practical lectures. Among them were the issues the umpires should know in taking right positions to suit the varied circumstances under the three-umpire and four-umpire systems to distinguish between right and wrong movements of players, the issues the coaches should not miss in the training for increasing ability of hurlers and batters and the issues arising in the establishment of attack and defence systems in accordance with the game situation.
 The course served as an occasion for boosting the quality of softball coaches and umpires.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Defence Minister
Kim Jong Il Receives Floral Basket from Mahmoud Abbas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Floral Basket from Mahmoud Abbas
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by Chief of the Palestinian National Authority Mahmoud Abbas on the occasion of the Day of the Sun. 
 It was conveyed by Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Mohammad Shahta Zarab to an official concerned on Thursday.

articles.title: Chinese Defence Minister Leaves
articles.content:
Chinese Defence Minister Leaves
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Col. General Cao Gangchuan, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, state councilor and minister of National Defence of the People's Republic of China, left here today after wrapping up his three-day visit to the DPRK. 
 The Chinese defense minister and his party were seen off at the airport by Kim Jong Gak, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army, Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Yang Xilian, military attache of the Chinese embassy, staff members of the embassy, Chinese guests staying here and Chinese students studying here.
